law.catch_line: Role of court in administration of trust.

text.section: The court may intervene in the administration of a trust to the extent its jurisdiction is invoked by an interested person or as provided by law.
A trust is not subject to continuing judicial supervision unless ordered by the court.

A judicial proceeding involving a trust may relate to any matter involving the trustâ€™s administration, including a request for instructions, an action to declare rights, and an action to settle the trusteeâ€™s accounts.
